content.rendered:
What is a Statistician?

Statisticians apply their knowledge of mathematical and statistical analysis to practical issues at a company or research organization. From developing surveys to analyzing survey data, they collect valuable data that can advance research in a field or solve a consumer problem.

Where does a Statistician work?

  • Government
  • Universities
  • Healthcare industries

How much does a Statistician make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Statistician is $62,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Statisticians?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Statistics majors
  • Math majors
  • Economics majors
Search Statistician jobs on Handshake

Statistician skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Statisticians succeed in their work:

  • Solid knowledge of mathematical techniques
  • Understanding of applicable programming languages
  • Good problem solving skills

What are some common questions about Statisticians?

Q: What degree does a Statistician need?

A: At least a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Some employers might ask for a master’s degree in statistics.
